page.title: 13Radway Green
page.content: In the early days of World War II Alsager was transformed from a sleepy country village into a war base throbbing with noisy evacuee children from Liverpool. In 1940 the urgent need for munitions saw the establishment of the thirteenth Royal {Ordinance factory}at{Radway Green}in the south west corner of the parish. The factory continues to operate and some days the noise of distant firing can be heard as testing is carried out. Local residents appear not to notice it anymore and pay little attention even when large explosions occur. Munition workers flooded into Alsager during the war period and urgently needed accommodation constructed for them continues to be a housing estate. Nowadays workers travel to Radway Green from all parts of Cheshire and Staffordshire.
